alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 5:05PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Leslie, northern Letcher, southeastern Perry, southern Knott, southeastern Floyd and southwestern Pike Counties through 530 PM EST... At 505 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Viper, or near Hazard, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Vicco, Sassafras, Wiscoal, Anco, Arminta, Elic, Bluefield, Red Star, Hallie and Ritchie around 510 PM EST. Letcher, Blackey, Smithsboro, Cody, Carr Creek, Gander, Carcassonne, Amburgey, Carbon Glow and David around 515 PM EST. Bath, Littcarr, Spider, Redfox, Dirk, Amelia, Sackett, Isom, Brinkley and Mallie around 520 PM EST. Pippa Passes, May, Omaha, Nealy, Colson, Pine Top, Drew, Ivan, Polly and Lester around 525 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wheelwright, Fleming-Neon, Hall, Deane, Greenleaf, Democrat, Halo, Dry Creek, Lucastown and Kite. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Floyd; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Perry; Pike
